query: what is the latest US political news?

result.query: what is the latest US political news?

articles.title: Senate G.O.P. Includes Expanded Fund for Radiation Victims in Policy Bill
articles.description: The provision, long advocated by Senator Josh Hawley of Missouri, would revive and broaden a law for compensating those who developed serious illnesses from government-caused nuclear contamination.

articles.title: State Dept. Official Posts, Then Deletes, Attack on Colleague About NATO
articles.description: Christopher Landau, the deputy secretary of state, criticized the U.S. ambassador to NATO in a reply to a routine social media post about meetings with foreign diplomats.

articles.title: Trump Withdraws From Agreement With Tribes to Protect Salmon
articles.description: The Biden administration had brokered a 10-year truce in an extended legal battle with Native American tribes in the Pacific Northwest over dams that had prevented fish from spawning.

articles.title: Protesters in Chicago return to the streets.
At least 22 states join California in its effort to block Trump’s troop deployment.
articles.description: Washington State, Vermont and others have joined a legal brief backing Gov. Gavin Newsom’s request to block the deployment of California’s National Guard.

articles.title: Here’s the latest.
How many people have been arrested in the nationwide anti-ICE protests?
articles.description: Police have arrested more than 1,000 people in the past week as civil unrest that began after immigration sweeps in Los Angeles spread to cities across the country.

articles.title: Missouri joins Texas in assembling National Guard troops.
articles.description: Texas activated its National Guard earlier this week ahead of protests there. Missouri is following suit, “taking a proactive approach,” its governor says.

articles.title: Judge Blocks Trump’s Use of National Guard to Deal With Protesters
articles.description: Judge Charles Breyer ordered the administration to return control of the National Guard to the California governor. But he also ruled that it was premature to restrict the use of active-duty Marines.

articles.title: Curfews Have Calmed Some Immigration Protests, but They Can Have Mixed Results
articles.description: Los Angeles and Spokane, Wash., have turned to curfews to control unrest, but past measures, especially in 2020, have not always been effective.

articles.title: Chris Mason: Reeves and Starmer can't escape sluggish economy
articles.description: The PM and chancellor badged their Spending Review as start of a new chapter but the economic backdrop is inescapable.

articles.title: Bangladesh leader declines to meet Tulip Siddiq
articles.description: Muhammad Yunus says he has confidence in the Bangladeshi authorities investigating the Labour MP.

articles.title: Labour must tell its working class story, says minister
articles.description: Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds says his party must get better at countering Nigel Farage's message.

articles.title: Peers criticise £9.6m House of Lords front door
articles.description: Upgrades to the Peers' Entrance have been branded a "white elephant and a disaster".

articles.title: Reeves refuses to rule out tax rises after economy shrinks
articles.description: The chancellor highlights "uncertainty" in the world as economists warn of tax rises if the economy fails to grow.

articles.title: No threat to British sovereignty over Gibraltar deal, says Lammy
articles.description: It comes after the UK agreed a deal with the European Union over the territory's post-Brexit future.

articles.title: Data bill opposed by Sir Elton John and Dua Lipa finally passes
articles.description: Leading artists said the bill needed to be changed to protect them from having their work copied by AI.

articles.title: Council tax expected to rise by 5% a year
articles.description: Council tax is expected to rise by 5% a year to pay for local services, documents in the Spending Review suggest.

articles.title: Drakeford loses temper with Plaid leader
articles.description: Drakeford accuses Rhun ap Iorwerth of being "very bad at listening" as he is heckled.

articles.title: Lyons dismisses resignation calls over  Larne attack Facebook post
articles.description: A crowd attacked the leisure centre hours after a minister revealed that migrants were being temporarily housed there.
